thread.title: 3 Best Bets: ride, climb, learn trail safety
thread.title_full: 3 Best Bets: ride, climb, learn trail safety

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: 3 Best Bets: ride, climb, learn trail safety
text:
1. Bike and run for Breast Cancer: Take part in the 5th annual Breast Cancer Ride and Run at Mendon Ponds Park on Sunday, Oct. 11. A 5K run and 1-mile walk will begin at 8 a.m. Cyclists will ride 10, 25 or 50 miles, starting from Stewart Lodge at 10 a.m. Registration is $40 to ride or $25 to run. For more details call (585) 381-2808. 2. Trail emergency workshop: Learn how to react in an emergency while on a trail at a free interactive workshop led by members of the Genesee Valley Ski Patrol on Wednesday, Oct. 14. The workshop is slated to begin at 6:30 p.m. at the Eisenhart Auditorium at the Rochester Museum and Science Center, 657 East Ave. The workshop will include both summer and winter situations and how to handle a lost group member. For more details call (585) 987-1717 or go to www.gvc-adk.org .
3. Stair Climb: The Fight for Air Stair Climb will be held on Saturday, Oct. 17 in the Legacy Tower, 1 Bausch and Lomb Place, Rochester. The event, which runs from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m., will raise funds and awareness for the American Lung Association. Participants will climb the 20-story building. It's $35 to register and participants are asked to raise at least $100. For more, call (585) 666-1402 or go to www.fightforairclimb.org .
